column10: I am open to any amount of students who need placement! Always a great addition to the class!

Since the children don't get back from lunch until about 12:15, is it possible for the volunteer to come from 12:15 - 1:15 instead of 12:00 - 1:00?Thank you so much! We are looking forward to the volunteers!

column7: Math, Science, Reading, Writing, After-School Program
column10: This is an after school program that runs 2:00-6:00 and we have 50 students from Pre K-5th grade that attend.  We are primarily looking for volunteers to help assist with reading in the PreK-1st grade groups and then math/science for 2nd-5th grade groups.  We begin homework time at 3:30 until 4:45.  I prefer to have at least two volunteers but at most 4 would be amazing!  Volunteers can come a little early or stay a little to play with our students!Thank you!Jessica RileyAgnor Hurt Site Facilitator for After School (EDEP)

Please note that I am the music teacher, and I see all 6 different grades every single day, depending on the time slot.I can have up to 3 volunteers at the same time.You are all awesome- thanks so much!!!

I have 2 small ESOL groups, one of Kindergarten students and one of 3rd graders, but it'd be helpful to have a volunteer who could help the students with their reading or writing, check and edit their work, etc. Sometimes, part of the class will need to do an activity as an independent state-mandated alternative assessment (portfolio work) and the others won't, so the volunteer may be able to work with a small group occasionally also, if acceptable. Is working with various students at different times okay, or does it need to be one-on-one?
Would love some help with Friday choice centers morning or afternoon! Thanks!

It would be wonderful to have volunteers during our literacy block to help with reading and writing. It would be helpful to have a volunteer who knows how to communicate in spanish for students in my class (but not required).
The number of volunteers does not really matter that much. I would like consistency and commitment so the children can depend on having a CAV during this time slot.

I checked the box for Literacy from 8:30-9:30.I checked the box for Math from 10:30-11:30. If possible could the volunteers come at 10:25-11:25? So grateful to all of you who come and serve our community.

column7: Reading, helping children find books in library
column10: The number of volunteers doesn't matter as much as their availability during the days/times indicated.

The 8-9am slot is Virginia Studies. I would like one of my ESL students to work one on one with a volunteer. The other volunteer(s) would work with a small group. The session begins at 8:15.The 9-10, 10-11, and 11-12 slots are for Literacy. Volunteers would work one one and with small groups on word study, fluency, reading comprehension, and problem based learning.
Music classes are active and fun- lots of dancing, music games etc. :)Please don't wear 'dressy' clothes - we are on the floor a lot with games-  jeans are perfect.Thanks so much :)
I am teaching in a multiage pod K-2.
My students rotate to three different Blocks / teachers.  **The 12-1 time slot officially begins with students at 12:20 when the students return from lunch.**

column7: Math, Science, Reading, Writing, Social Studies

column10: Volunteers will help students during math stations from 9:15-10:15 (if possible)during independent reading and writing stations from 11-12

column7: Math, Science, Reading, Writing, Social Studies
column10: I would probably use the UVA students to works side by side with a struggling student.

I need some clarification on the question listed above... "how many different volunteers would you like per week?"I'd like to have a volunteer every day if possible so I thought that the answer of 5 covered having one volunteer each day of the week. I could be wrong about this.I'm dreaming big here with my listed requests, I know. My parent volunteer turnout is just one parent every other week so it's been a challenge to accomplish all that I want with an extra set of hands and give my struggling students some much needed intervention. I also checked multiple time slots for each day to indicate when in the day I need help. I know I probably can not get as much help as selected on the form, but like I said before...I'm going all out and seeing what help I can get from the days and times I listed. The earliest morning slots (8-9 or 8:30-9:30) would be one on one help with struggling students. The time slots of  9-10 and  are during our Language Arts rotations. I like volunteers to oversee games / activities of independent groups or work1:1 or 2:1 with a students who needs help finishing work or need extra practice with something.The mid-afternoon slot is social studies on Wednesdays.The later afternoon slot is writing time. The volunteer will help me assist students in their writing workshop, answer questions, proofread writing, or other writing help.Hope my explanations help. Thanks so so much!!!Aimee Travers
Katie B. - Are you available this semester to volunteer in my room?Kimberly Geer
average math group could use support

Having a volunteer during literacy stations time (8:30-10:00) would be wonderful.  The volunteer could have students practice reading to him/her or be in charge of a fun station.We have writing M/W/F from 11:45-12:15 and Intervention/Enrichment T/TH from 11:45-12:15.  Help could be used in both.  They're both followed by math from 12:15-1:15.  Math volunteers could work one on one with students or in small groups.  It could be assisting students who need extra help or pulling students for an enrichment challenge (volunteer choice).I went to UVA too, class of 2010.  Wahoowa!
This is a time of day when we have 3 First grade classes for PE. Additional help would be great.
Due to my schedule this year, I can only take a volunteer for the 10:00-11:00 time slot.
My classes are K-4 grade and 45 minutes long. I blocked the closest time to cover the 45 minutes of class. I have a small classroom so not enough room for more than 1 volunteer at a time. Thanks!
I have marked every day of the week since we are pretty available at the same time every day of the week. I would welcome as many tutors as needed!

column7: Math, Science, Reading, Writing, Social Studies
Math, Science, Reading, Writing, Social Studies
column10: Please email me if you have any more questions!

I am the itinerant Spanish teacher at Burnley-Moran.  Volunteers must be able to read, speak and comprehend basic Spanish (classroom vocabulary, commands, novice level passages.)   They will mostly be facilitating groupwork or taking small groups of 3-4 students to other classrooms for Spanish reading buddies.  Any Curry foreign language ed students will be welcome to try out short lessons.
I do not need coverage for the entire time. Those slots chosen are available for your tutors to chose from. Thanks!

I am not sure if you are offering this to Pre-K programs as I noticed Pre-K was not an option for the grade selection above, but thought I would try. We are a Pre-Kindergarten program within Charlottesville City Schools serving 4-5 year old children who are at risk and/or have disabilities in an inclusive classroom environment.

column7: Math, Science, Reading, Writing, Social Studies
column10: We are happy to have any volunteers in our class!
I am looking for someone to work with students one-on-one or with a small group.
I am looking for someone to work with students one-on-one or with a small group.

column7: Math, Science, Reading, Writing, Social Studies, Foreign Language, Immersion Spanish classroom, knowing Spanish would be a plus!
column10: This is a Spanish immersion classroom, knowing Spanish would be a plus.

Ours is a Spanish Immersion classroom, and all instruction is in Spanish.    strong spanish communication skills are a must.   Ideally, it would be wonderful to have a volunteer come once a week for the am class 10:30-11;30, and either the same volunteer, or a different volunteer to  come once a week for the pm class 12:30-1:30 (am and pm classes have different students, both classes are spanish only.)please let me know if you have questions.Thanks!

I am teaching language arts and history in 3rd grade. I'd love an extra set of hands each day to help with our Daily Five rounds. Volunteers would learn how students become more independent in an upper elementary classroom. I serve two classes of students. They have been clustered so that I serve the gifted students and the SPED/ Title students. Volunteers would be able to see a wide range of learning styles and abilities within my two classes. Thank you!

column7: Math, Reading, Writing, Social Studies, Foreign Language
column10: I would love to have any student who would be willing to speak Spanish while in my class.  Otherwise, I would prefer not to have a student.  Also, please no more than 1 volunteer at a time. Thanks!
I would love to have at least one volunteer Monday -Thursday from 11:00-12:00 if that is possible.  Thank you so much.
Need a bilingual student!!!
Wants 3

column7: Math, Science, Reading, Writing, Social Studies

column10: Hi Maddie, As you know, I work with lots of different grades-- 8-830 would be 1st, 8:30-9:30 would be 2nd, 11:30-12:30 K, 12:30-1:30 1st.  I said 2 volunteers, but I know that I have plenty of opportunities for volunteers to help with math during those slots, so if you are needing placements for more people, feel free to assign me more!

I have already recommended two students I believe would benefit from one on one tutoring in the classroom.  These students would not work well together, therefore I would like one volunteer to work with each student on alternating days, or two volunteers at a time.  Thank you!
Would love one each day of the week

We welcome volunteers who balance fun and friendly with professionalism, who will read books and do literacy-oriented activities with young students, and interact positively with students while also being a good role model. Our students tend to bond quickly with a "friend" who returns each week, or several times a week, and we look forward to Cavs visiting and helping!

column7: individual work while we do centers
column10: My classroom is a PreK classroom but that choice was not available to check.  Morning is the prefered time.  Afternoon time is not as important as the morning time but a few students are no longer napping and having someone to work with them would be good.Would love to have Lachlan Davis back again!!!!

I will be happy to have as many or as few volunteers that can help!  Ideally, we would like to have no more than 3 volunteers in the room at the same time.  If we did actually have 5 individuals working with our class, it would be great if they could all come at different time blocks.Thanks very much!

column7: Foreign Language, Help with ess students (spanish)
column10: I have four children in my class who speak no English at all, and need support in learning to be functional in the classroom and understand what is expected of them.
I would appreciate volunteers who could come in and help students read fluently and help student plan their writing.

column7: Math, Science, Reading, Writing, Social Studies
column10: I would like to have 2 volunteers at the sane time for the mornings, if possible, and 1 in the afternoon. Thank you for your consideration.
Mondays and Tuesdays would be my first choice.Thank you!
We have grades K-4. feel free to send as many or as few volunteers as you would like. Preferably Gentleman.
We have recess at 11:45.  So if someone wants to come from 10:45-11:45 one of those days, that would be ideal.  Or if it's just 11:00-11:45 that's fine.  Thank you!
We go to recess at 11:50, so tutoring can end at that time on all days.  The majority of the tutoring will be in reading, but I did ask for one math time slot (Monday, 9:30-10:30).Thank you!

column10: My preference is Friday's from 1:15-2:30, but any day of the week will work if Fridays do not.  Thanks!!
This is a pre-k classroom.
Thank you!
Last semester Katie Rosebach was in my classroom and did a wonderful job.  If she is available at all, I would love to have her again.
I would love some help with one-on-one writing and reading with students while I conduct guided reading groups.

I appreciate any and all help that comes my way.  I have 6 students currently reading below grade level who are not ESOL and another 3 who are reading significantly below grade level who are ESOL.  I have been thrilled with the wonderful volunteers in the past, so I am just grateful for any that are able to work with my students this semester.
Volunteer would help kindergarten students participate in class.  Helping students focus and giving individual attention would be helpful.

Thanks!

column10: I would love to have some volunteers to help me with my first graders.  We will be working a lot in centers and I could use the extra hands to work with children during centers.  I could also use a volunteer who would like to have a particular student to buddy read or do buddy math with each week.  I also have a high population of ESL students who could use extra help with writing and spelling.
My students have recess from 10:20-10:40. Ideally the volunteer would be from the 10:40-11:40 time slot for Math and 8:30-9:30 for reading.
I am requesting volunteers for my whole grade level team.  We would appreciate if all 4 volunteers could come at the same time.

Katen and I were waiting for your e-mail. Hope that you had a great winter break. Looking forward to seeing you.Eileen
I would prefer someone from 9:30-10:30 (math), 10:30-11:30 (reading) or 11:00-12:00 (reading).Logan, you're awesome!

column10: This classroom is a functional skills classroom with students with severe disabilities.

I have enjoyed having the wonderful volunteers from UVA in my classroom for many years. I have been so pleased with their enthusiasm and assistance. I look forward to meeting the new group for this year.

My classes are 45 mins long and did not all fit into the hour block so the volunteers may want to adjust their hour 5-10 mins if they are assigned to my classroom. I can work with them via email in advance to set a time that maximizes their time with students. Thanks so much!

The times do not line up with our schedule exactly. I would like volunteers if they are available during math instruction 8:15-9:15 or reading instruction 9:45-11:00. I would be happy to talk with volunteers about the different times if they have questions. Thanks!
Just wanted to make a note about the request I sent in but didn't have a way to go back to that request. Wednesdays will no longer work for my class, but Mon, Tues, Thurs, Fri are still okay. Thanks!
Students seek attention and will look forward to the time when the CAVS come to spend time with them.

Helping with small groups on whatever the task is for day.Morning times would usually be for math. Afternoon times would usually be for literacy. Both men and women would be great! 3 (or 4) volunteers would be ideal but if the number needs to be less, that is fine! I will take as many volunteers as possible.
I believe I have one returning from the Fall Semester.  Her name was Sydney.  Thank you!  She came on Tuesdays.

We had Anna Sawyer in the Fall and hope that she can return this spring.Also, I would like to have a man that would volunteer one or two days a week. That would be the Tuesday and Thursday time slots that I picked. If there is not a man available, then I do not need the help. Thanks, Becky

column7: Science, Reading, Writing, Social Studies, ESL student
column10: Looking for two female volunteers to work with 1ESL student 2 times each week.  Cara and Nonye worked with this student in the fall 2014 semester.   I could also use activity and games coordinators for playground at 11:00 everyday.  Lead lunch conversations and supervise a table from 11:30-12:00.Thanks for all your help and support.
I would take up to 3 volunteers. However, I would prefer not to have them on the same day, if possible. Thanks so much. Leslie
I have 3 Special Education Students this year.  It would be very helpful to have an extra pair of hands to help with staying on task, reading directions, or working with small groups.Thank you
I'm a pre k classroom. There was no option for pre k grade level.
No more than two.  2:00-3:30 would be ideal.   Thanks!
The exact time for Thursday would be 1:30-2:15. I will not need anyone until Sept. 10.  Thanks so much!
Contact Kaley for info; only need 1 volunteer for this, and better if any Spanish knowledge
Tuesdays and Thursdays more important than Fridays

It would be great if the students had someone to read to during our literacy block.  Many of our struggling readers need someone to sit with them and give them feedback and help them figure out new words.  It would also be great to have someone to help students with their writing.  Volunteers would either be working with students one on one or with a small group of a few.  I am wiling to have as many volunteers as is reasonable on whatever days fit their schedules.Thanks!
If possible, I would like to request 3 volunteers Monday-Friday for the 8:30 - 9:30 block in addition to 2 volunteers Monday-Friday for the 9:45 - 11:30 block.Thanks so much!!!
I am at Stony Point and I know it's very hard to have someone drive all the way out here ,but it would be nice if we could get someone. If possible it would be grades pk-5
While I do have students with learning disabilities and ESL, it is not essential that the volunteers have prior experience with these areas.Thanks!
I could take 2 volunteers at a time, if needed.

Here's my schedule each day if it's easier this way:8:20-9:20 Math9:20-9:30 Snack/Read Aloud9:30-11:20 Language ArtsI'll take as many volunteers throughout the week as you want to send me, but more than 1 at a time can be more distracting than helpful.Thank you so much! The kids love seeing you all!!My ideal situation is to use volunteers mostly to help children with their seatwork while I have reading groups during Language Arts. (9:30-11:20 every day)

column7: Math, Reading, Writing, Social Studies, Vocabulary/Spelling
column10: Two of the times I requested are off by a few minutes.  The daily 10:30 to 11:30 time is really 10:20 to 11:20.  The daily 1:00- 2:00 time is really 1:10 to 2:10Thanks,Maggi Sams

Sarah Kouchevery volunteered with me last semester and I would love to have her back.  Although I've indicated my preferred times above, I can be flexible.  The times I would like her are ideally from 9:00 - 10:15.  I picked Wednesday but I can do a different weekday if Wednesday does not work for her.

I really need reliable tutors during math time this semester.  I would love to have tutors who have worked with me before if possible, and will take new tutors as well.Our math time is 8:30-9:45.  If I just have them for 1 hour 8:30-9:30 is the best.Thank you!Kristi
One volunteer a day and per slot is great!Thank you,Lisa

I am having a student teacher in March as well so I need to limit to 1 volunteer at a time. My classes are in 45 minute blocks so there is flexibility in the times if they need to come a few minutes earlier/later. I teach K-4 grade (wasn't an option above).

I am interested in having a volunteer work with children in the reading corner.  It will be a group of 5 or less students.  The volunteer can support students reading books on their own or can do a read aloud for the group.
This my literacy time. I would love to have a volunteer work with my students during their independent reading rotation station.
WE LOVE all of our CAVS volunteers! THANK YOU!!!!
When I need help:math 8:30-9:30, or 8:45-9:45literacy 12-1Thank you
My classes are in 45 min blocks so I did the closest time available to account for that 45 min block. Love this program! Thanks!
These are for PE.  I tried to match our schedule as close as I could to the one listed for each day above.  We do not start or end on the hour/half hour.

I will take however many you have available whether it's more than three or not! I'm also not ridged on only have one at a time but have found it generally runs smoother with only one volunteer in the room at a time.
I need a Spanish Speaking Tutor. This is a Spanish I class.
Ideally, I would like to have two volunteers per time slot to support our 5th grade reading class.Thanks, Cianna
A volunteer to read one on one with students would be great.
The 1:30 - 2:30 on Wednesdays and Thursdays are 4th grade art classes. My first choice is to have a volunteer in the kindergarten art classes from 12:30 - 1:30 on Wednesdays and Thursdays. Thank you!
We'd love to work with Hailey Foreman if she's interested.
I would gladly have any of the 4 Madison House Volunteers that we had last semester.  They all did a great job and have formed relationships with our preschoolers.

Our program runs 2:00-6:00 and preferably we need more assistance after 3:30 PM.Thank you!

I'm looking for some volunteers to help support our after school program for 1st grade ESOL students on Tuesday from 2:45-4:00.I'm also looking for a volunteer to work with a 1st grade student (girl) on Fridays from 2:30-3:30.

Hi Kajal!I'm looking forward to having you all back again this year! I'll take any after school help I can get Mon-Wed and maybe Friday. Does Becca Stein volunteer through your program? If so, I'd love to request her as a volunteer and work out any hours that suit her. She worked for me this summer and was great! Also, the same for Becca Pryor - I know she didn't have a car. Just let me know what works for you and I'll work things out on my end. I have to check with my principal to see when our after school programming begins this fall. Could be students from grades other than 1st.Take Care,Elizabeth Coppolino
